resources.string: This example uses a default setup, where the criteria are defined as layout attributes via XML.
This example uses the IrrAdapterDecorator, to auto-manage the IRR at 10th position of a list.
This example demonstrates the use of a custom rule engine created in code, with custom rules. Rating Request will show up below if it is weekend.
This example shows the flexibility to adopt the IrrLayout to your own needs. The element behaves and looks roughly like a snackbar.
Rating Request will show up, if the rule engine evaluates to true. Use the button controls to modify the data used for decision making.
Special thanks to Circa Team for Insights about integrated rating requests Niek Haarman for ListViewAnimations, Qamar Loop for Social Icons and the Google Android teams.
